intro: Talauma hodgsonii, commonly known as the Himalayan talauma, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Talauma hodgsonii is often found in forest understories and is valued for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
